name: s3://eodata/CLMS/bio-geophysical/vegetation_properties/fapar_global_300m_10daily_v2
browserSearchPath: CLMS Bio-geophysical Parameters, Vegetation, Vegetation Properties
collectionDescription: Quantifies the fraction of the solar radiation absorbed by live plants for photosynthesis. Every 10-days estimates are available at global scale in the spatial resolution of ~ 300 m from January 2014 to the present. More information here.

layers.shortDescription: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation
layers.longDescription: FAPAR represents the fraction of photosynthetically active radiation [0.4-0.7 Î¼m] that is absorbed by vegetation. FAPAR is defined as the instantaneous at 10:00 local times.

layers.shortDescription: Root Mean Square Error on FAPAR
layers.longDescription: RMSE is computed between the final dekadal FAPAR value and the available valid instantaneous values in the compositing window.

layers.shortDescription: Number of available valid instantaneous FAPAR
layers.longDescription: Number of available valid instantaneous FAPAR values in the compositing window.

layers.shortDescription: Length of the semi-period before the date [days]
layers.longDescription: Length of the semi-period before the dekadal date of the compositing window [days].

layers.shortDescription: Length of the semi-period after the date [days]
layers.longDescription: Length of the semi-period after the dekadal date of the compositing window [days].
